name: Blockchain Dashboard - Sample

examples.text: I want to know about Bitcoin
Hi, Watson. I want to stop car
finally reached home.. lock up and cock up.. good nite and good bye for ever
hey, now it's raining, you said you didn't know anything about that. Are you a liar?
can you guess what it is ?
What is a peer in Blockchain?
you can go with your favorite
I did not say turn in anything I entered
I am not identifying any thing here
What are some key concepts of Blockchain?
Tell me about a Certificate Authority
I would like you to say hello
Hi, Watson, my name is John
I want to know about Blockchain
what is the best route to a gas station
How long does it take to get the first gas station?
how do i get from here to there
Hi Watson! Please enable the GPS.
can you navigate to my home
what can you do. turn off lights
what can you do . turn off lights
Turn up the radio.Turn on my wipers.
turn up the music and slow down the wipers
turn on wipers and stop the car
turn on the wipers then turn them off
turn on the lights, then turn them off.
turn on the lights and turn up the wipers
turn on the lights and speed up the wipers
turn off wipers and turn on the lights
turn off wipers and turn on lights
turn off the music and then turn it up
turn off the heater and turn on the AC
turn off the headlights and on the air con
turn off on off the music
turn down the heat and play some jazz
switch on the ac then turn up the music
speed up the wipers then slow down the wipers
sorry turn off the lights and turn on the AC
OK, can you lower the AC to turn off the sound?
lower the volume then speed up the wipers
Increase the volume or turn off the AC
increase the speed of the wipers and turn up the music
Increase speed and turn wiper on
can you turn on the turn off the AC
can you please turn the light on off ?
can you please turn the light  either on of off ?

values: The Certificate Authority (CA) provides a number of certificate services to users of a blockchain. More specifically, these services relate to user enrolment, transactions invoked on the blockchain, and TLS-secured connections between users or components of the blockchain.https://openblockchain.readthedocs.io/en/latest/Setup/ca-setup/#transaction-certificate-authority
Hello! I'm doing good. I'm here to help you learn more about Blockchain. Just say the word.

Bitcoin is a cryptocurrency and worldwide payment system that was created by Satoshi Nakamoto year 2007. Bitcoin is one of many s.c. crypto currencies used in the world today. For more information, see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bitcoin
I'm sorry I haven't been able to help you.

dialog_nodes.previous_sibling: Entry Point For On Off Commands

values: I'm trained to turn things on or off in the car dashboard, play music and find nearby amenities like restaurants, gas stations and restrooms.

A Blockchain User connects to the network through a peer node (A). Before proceeding with any transactions, the node retrieves the user's enrolment and transaction certificates from the Certificate Authority. Users must possess these digital certificates in order to transact on a permissioned network.
A Blockchain Peer is a node with the following attributes: ...
Blockchain Was created by Satoshi Nakamoto in 2007

Blockchain is a continuously growing list of records, called blocks, which are linked and secured using cryptography. Each block typically contains a hash pointer as a link to a previous block, a timestamp and transaction data. A blockchain can serve as "an open, distributed ledger that can record transactions between two parties efficiently and in a verifiable and permanent way." For use as a distributed ledger, a blockchain is typically managed by a peer-to-peer network collectively adhering to a protocol for validating new blocks.
Blockchain is a distributed ledger that underlies Bitcoin and cryptocurrencies as well as trading networks

output.text: Okay! Speak to you soon about Blockchain!
Satoshi Nakamoto is the anonomous creator of Bitcoin and Blockchain. Please see his paper Bitcoin: A Peer-to-Peer Electronic Cash System https://bitcoin.org/bitcoin.pdf

values: Peers, Certificate Authority, Consensus, Chaincode, Smart Contracts

Blockchain is a distributed ledger conceptualised by Satoshi Nakamoto in 2007. Blockchain is described in Satoshi's paper Bitcoin: A Peer-to-Peer Electronic Cash System https://://bitcoin.org/bitcoin.pdf

Initial coin offering (ICO) is an unregulated and controversial means of crowdfunding via use of cryptocurrency,[1] which can be a source of capital for startup companies.[2] In an ICO a percentage of the newly issued cryptocurrency is sold to investors in exchange for legal tender or other cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin.

Early token sales were held by Mastercoin in July 2013 and Ethereum and Karmacoin in 2014, but "mainstream" ICOs began with messaging app developer Kik in September 2017. By November 2017 there were around 50 offerings a month.
IBM Blockchain Use Cases all run in the IBM Cloud. Please go to this URL to read up on IBM Blockchain Use cases: https://www.ibm.com/blockchain/business-use-cases.html
Hyperledger is an open source version of Blockchain maintained by the Linux Foundation. It is free to use. The source is stored on Github and the URL to hyperledger is http://hyperledger.org/

values: Satoshi Nakamoto was the inventor of Blockchain and Bitcoin. See his paper Bitcoin: A Peer-to-Peer Electronic Cash System from 2007

A cryptocurrency is a digital asset designed to work as a medium of exchange using cryptography to secure the transactions, to control the creation of additional units, and to verify the transfer of assets.

Hi. I am your friendly Blockchain Chatbot.  What would you like me to tell you about Blockchain?  I know about Blockchain, Satoshi Nakamoto, Bitcoin, Cryptocurrencies, Peers, Certificate Authority, Consensus, Chaincode, Smart Contracts. As well as about IBM Blockchain Use Cases. Or why not take a look at the Glossary? http://hyperledger-fabric.readthedocs.io/en/release/glossary.html
